results.title: Pauses
results.creator_credit: International Women's Year Committee, Melbourne State College and Monique Schwarz
results.brief_description: Examines the lives of three successful women who are in their forties. Joyce Nicholson, a writer and business woman, Helen Laycock, a potter and Rosie Smith who runs a craft business. Each describe their work and their experiences as a wife and mother. A useful film discussion starter about woman’s role in Australian society.

results.title: Pauline a la Plage = Pauline at the Beach
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Losange, Les Films Ariane, Margaret Menegoz and Eric Rohmer
results.brief_description:
The third of Rohmer’s Comedies et Proverbes series (see summary for La Femme de l’Aviateur) is prefaced by a medieval motto ‘Who talks o’ermuch, himself doth harm.’ At the centre of what has been described as ‘an airy comedy of manners, encompassing genuine pain’ is 15 year-old Pauline. Her ideals are put to a severe test when, during a holiday at Normandy, she is caught up in an emotional triangle which attendant hypocrisies transforms into an even more fraught hexagon.

Credits: Producer, Margaret Menegoz ; director, writer, Eric Rohmer ; photography, Nestor Almendros ; editor, Cecile Decugis.
Cast: Amanda Langlet, Arielle Dombasle, Pascal Greggory.

results.title: Paulina 1880
results.creator_credit: Albina du Boisrouvray and Jean-Louis Bertucelli
results.brief_description:
Paulina is the only daughter of an upper class family in 19th century Italy. She grows up under the preying eyes of her large and domineering family and can only dream about love. Between her dreams and her religious devotion, she finds time to fall in love with a married nobleman. Sensing the untenability of the situation, Paulina considers entering a convent, but not before she has a last encounter with her lover.

Credits: Producer, Albina du Boisrouvray ; director, Jean-Louis Bertucelli ; writers, Albina du Boisrouvray, Jean-Louis Bertucelli ; photography, Andreas Winding ; music, Nicolas Nabokov.
Cast: Olga Karlatos, Maximilian Schell, Eliana de Santis, Michel Bouquet, Sami Frey.

results.title: Paul Tomkowicz: street railway switchman
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Roman Kroitor
results.brief_description: In winter the rail-switches on streetcar tracks in Winnipeg would jam with freezing mud and snow. Keeping them clean, whatever the weather, was the job of the switchman. In this film about a bygone era, Paul Tomkowicz, Polish-born Canadian, talks about his job and his life in Canada. Awards: Edinburgh; Oberhausen

results.title: Paul Robeson: tribute to an artist
results.creator_credit: Janus Films and Saul J. Turell
results.brief_description: Using archival film footage, this film presents a profile of the outstanding singer and actor Paul Robeson. The film also examines Robeson’s outspoken opposition to racism and injustice and how these opinions eventually destroyed his career. Narrated by Sidney Poitier.

results.title: Paul Laurence Dunbar (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Presents some of the live-action stories written by Paul Laurence Dunbar, pointing out that even though he lived in a period that offered a black writer only poverty, he was ale to write both lyrical poetry and stories that dealt with themes that are still relevant today.

results.title: Paul Klee: child of creation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: King Screen Productions, Joe Valentine, Ed Leimbacher and Paul Taylor
results.brief_description: With a colourful flow of images, this film directly relates the work of the famous 20th century painter, Paul Klee, to the artistic creations of young children. Klee’s own words are complemented by youngsters’ candid comments to reveal an unmistakable kinship between master and young beginner. A delightful portrait of Paul Klee for all levels.

results.title: Paul Kane goes west
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Gerald Budner
results.brief_description: His canvases breathe with the spirit and pride of the Indian, and the untouched wilderness that was his domain. Travelling overland west to the Pacific in the mid-1800s, Paul Kane painted the northwest, the great Indian tribes, chiefs, ceremonies, war parties, buffalo hunts, rapids and waterfalls. In this film his paintings are projected with lighting that brings to life every glowing detail.

results.title: Paul Jennings
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: An interview with Australian children’s author and ex-teacher, Paul Jennings. Jennings’ books have been a runaway popular success since his first book, “Unreal” was published in 1985. He has since written “Unbelievable”, “Uncanny” and the “Round the Twist” series of stories. He believes books are very important for kids because, even more than television, they can take the imagination anywhere.
